content:
Diagnosis:
Gastrinoma of pancreatic head with regional nodal disease

Previous treatment:
Whipple's procedure March 2023
Commenced Lanreotide 120mg monthly from May 2023

Current medications:
Lanreotide 120mg monthly
Pantoprazole 40mg twice daily

Current situation:
Cycle 6 Lanreotide treatment review

Investigation results:
Gastrin level 180 pg/mL (down from 400 pg/mL at diagnosis)
Chromogranin A within normal range
CT scan 15/04/2024 shows no evidence of recurrence

I reviewed [redacted name] today for assessment during treatment with Lanreotide. Treatment has been well tolerated with only mild injection site reactions. His gastric symptoms are well controlled on current PPI dose. Weight is stable at 72kg. Performance status remains 0. Blood tests show continued biochemical response with gastrin now 180 pg/mL. Recent CT imaging confirms stable appearances with no evidence of recurrent disease. The plan is to continue with monthly Lanreotide injections and review again in 3 months with repeat imaging and biochemical markers.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: gastrin 400 pg/mL at diagnosis, chromogranin A positive

cancer_timeline.value: Gastrin reduced to 180 pg/mL, Chromogranin A normalized
CT scan shows no evidence of recurrence

patient_facts.value: Mild injection site reactions to Lanreotide

status_updates.value: Gastrinoma of pancreatic head post Whipple's procedure, showing good biochemical response to Lanreotide with stable disease on imaging
Biochemical response with gastrin reduction and normal chromogranin A, stable disease on CT
Mild injection site reactions to Lanreotide
Repeat imaging and biochemical markers in 3 months
